com.netflix.spectator.impl

Class AsciiSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.impl.AsciiSet

  • public final class AsciiSet
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for quickly checking if a string contains only characters contained within the given set. The set is limited to basic ascii with ranges, if you need more advanced patterns then regular expressions are a better option though it will likely come with a steep performance penalty.

    This class is an internal implementation detail only intended for use within spectator. It is subject to change without notice.

    • Method Detail

      • fromPattern

        public static AsciiSet fromPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Create a set containing ascii characters using a simple pattern. The pattern is similar to a character set in regex. For example, ABC would contain the characters A, B, and C. Ranges are supported so all uppercase letters could be specified as A-Z. The dash, -, will be included as part of the set if it is at the start or end of the pattern.
        Parameters:
        pattern - String specification of the character set.
        Returns:
        Set containing the characters specified in pattern.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(char c)
        Returns true if the character contained within the set. This is a constant time operation.

      • containsAll

        public boolean containsAll(java.lang.CharSequence str)
        Returns true if all characters in the string are contained within the set.

      • replaceNonMembers

        public java.lang.String replaceNonMembers(java.lang.String input,
                                          char replacement)
        Replace all characters in the input string with the replacement character.
